page.title: 05TRACK MAKING AT WORKINGTON
page.content: {The British Steel Corporation}at Workington reheats{blooms(Steel {sections)}and rolls them into a finished product.Blooms are {transported by rail from Teeside to {Workington.}The cold blooms are placed in reheating furnaces which are heated by natural gas,the temperature of the blooms is raised to approximately {white heat}which is over 1000C.At this temperature it is both malleable and ductile and ready for a{rolling process in No.1 mill.The blooms are now{cogged}down into a smaller bloom section and then sheared(cut)into lengths for further processing.The steel is then passed through{roughing and{finishing rolls}where it is rolled into 120 feet,113 pounds per yard steel rails.The rough ends are cut off with a saw while hot.After cooling the rails are{straightened}ready for sale.
